name: Mercure Fontenay sous Bois

reviews.text: We stayed there only 1 night as we went with bus tour from Germany. So I didn’t deal with the check in. the group of let’s say 40 pax arrived 1 pm. but one elevator is broken. The elevator itself is quite small. I think can fit 5 people with baggage. Many have to use stair. I used stair for 4th floor only let my mom get in. The room is okay. Extra bed is not so nice. They put the futon instead of mattress so my bed was a bit too soft. Breakfast is fine. They have champagne for breakfast I guess it’s a Paris thing. The waitress saw us and suddenly took to the room with Chinese group. The black waiter came and asked us room no., he checked and brought us outside. (as we came with German tour group) Breakfast is acceptable for 3 stars hotel. There is metro station near the hotel but we didn’t use. Overall if you want a short stay with the better price, It’s not too bad otherwise you can pay more and stay closer to Paris.
reviews.title: Reasonable for short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. As others have commented, the location is on the regional rail line, not the Metro. However, it is only 10-15 minutes to the city centre via the train and it only costs you an extra Euro or so for the trip, so if you get the hotel quite cheaply, it works out well for you. Taxi travel there would be costly.
reviews.title: Reasonable for the price - service poor

reviews.text: Others have noted that the area surrounding the hotel is a little shady. I would say it's an area with mostly workers and offices during the day; I personally did not feel unsafe but the bus terminal adjoining the train station is poorly lit so some may feel nervous about this. There is a shopping centre directly behind the hotel which is convenient.
reviews.title: Reasonable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the hotel - the room was a decent size. Cleanliness was of an acceptable level. I did not eat any food there, so cannot comment (I ate at a wonderful bakery behind the hotel - highly recommended). The shower head holder was broken in the bathroom, so it flooded the bathroom floor as a result. I had varying temperature showers for two mornings - I presumed this was usual "everyone using it at the same time" so didn't bother to report it.
reviews.title: VERY VERY POOR

reviews.text: There was a reason I didn't bother reporting it - the staff were very rude. I don't mean in a "French people are rude"-stereotypical fashion, they were just - well, rude. We checked into the hotel at 1am after a long travel day, so I fumbled with my French, then just went for English - I was told that I should "speak French, then English". When we checked out, they claimed we hadn't paid when we had. The desk clerk had not seen the email confirming we had. She fought us for a while, then when she realised her mistake, was absolutely frosty. The only person who was nice was one of the female desk clerks, who was only nice after she had to tell us bad news. The bad news was that despite the brochure claiming that laundry was available Monday to Saturday and could be picked up by 8pm same day if put in by 9am, we attempted to put through laundry on a Friday morning before 9am and were told it wouldn't be ready until after the weekend. Reason why? "The laundry is not open on the weekend". Paris is not filled with laundrettes, so we ended up with dirty clothes until Berlin.
reviews.title: Bad location and would not recommend this hotel
very good
reviews.text: slightly far away from Paris City center,but convenient to metro station(across the hotel).
if one does not mind to ride 20 mins in Metro to the city center, I recommend this hotel. As the hotel rate is good and the room is spaceous.
reviews.title: Does not improve a coach trip

reviews.text: Our room was very clean yet other reviews suggest this was a one off. The shower is a bit dodgy, the water pressure if fine but the shower attachment is so poor that the whole floor will be able to accomadate Nemo by the time your shower is over. The television channels are all in French bar BBC world news however it is not specific to any continent so you will find it impossible to get specific news. Do not let small children near the windows as they are very wide and open fully so children need to be constantly supervised. Breakfast is a bit dodgy, it's mainly continental and consists of 10% fruit yogurt, croissants, make it yourself toast and some abigiuous looking sausage and bacon and some distinctly saw dust looking scrambled eggs. If you are going in the week you will probably be ok because there is a restaurant however we came at the weekend and there is no restaurant and there is also no room service so the only way to get food is to go around the corner of the hotel to a kind of mini mall which has restaurants like mcdonalds, kfc, a pizza place amongst others as well as some nice shops but the area is questionable. Some people have commented how they feel unsafe and there are some "suspicious" looking people outside that some people may find unnerving. Staff are not particulary helpful or friendly and seem unaccustomed to dealing with people so aren't much help if you require it. It is also important to note that this hotel is not particularly close to central Paris. But as mentioned earlier it's very clean which is good however that is just our experience we have heard from other guests that their rooms are dirty and have things like cracked tiles in them. Another comment would be that, in our case, we booked a twin bed room but we were given a room with a double bed, not a huge problem but could be for others. Also you can hear you can hear everything that goes on in the floors above. The lifts are quite cramped and can only hold a small number of 4/5 at a time which may be an issue for some people. There isn't anything really to do in the hotel if you don't want to go out given the lack of television or in-hotel entertainment, the shops close at 8pm every day except for Sunday when they are all shut so it would be advisable to bring some sort of entertainment with you. An important tip to anyone going to stay here would be to bring some food as well as entertainment just in case because their isn't anything avaliable in the hotel. Good option possibly for anyone using this hotel on a business trip but not a holiday, personally we would not book this hotel again.
reviews.title: Would not recommend

reviews.text: I stayed here as part of a group of college students I was helping to lead around Europe, and this was one of our least favorite hotels. The downstairs area was alright, but the rooms were pretty bad - ripped carpet, wallpaper, box springs, etc. It was also extremely noisy. I'm not sure if they were doing construction or what but at times it sounded like someone was going to come through the roof. Also, even though they supposedly have air conditioning, it didn't work in any one of the 8 rooms we had for our group. The breakfast didn't really have much to offer, and the location is pretty far outside of Paris. It took us a good 45 minutes to get anywhere in downtown Paris via local transport.
reviews.title: Don't Expect Much

reviews.text: The two positives were that the metro station was literally across the street and there was free internet (although not for programs such as Skype). Unless you're really on a tight budget for Paris I would suggest finding a different hotel.
reviews.title: Don't expect a welcome from the staff

reviews.text: THIS HOTEL IS UNDERGOING RENOVATIONS - MAJOR ELECTRICAL PROBLEMS! Day 1 - Our 5th floor room lights & tv flickered on/off all evening. During the night (lights / tv were off) our TV short- circuited. We saw a bright white flash and smoke/ burning smell coming from TV. The staff was unconcerned & blamed it on the electricians who went home hours ago. I checked for fire exits near our room!
reviews.title: AVOID THIS HOTEL - SAFETY ISSUES!

reviews.text: Day 2 - our room had NO electricity when we returned at 11:30 p.m. We were moved to 3rd floor room at midnight. That room had NO working lights in the bathroom. We had to ask for a flashlight so we could collect our belongings from the dark 5th floor room and for use in the bathroom in the 3rd floor room. Again, staff blamed the problems on the electricians who were off for the weekend!
reviews.title: Close to the RER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Several other families in our tour had to be moved to other rooms for lack of electricity. One mother & small boy stayed in a room with NO electricity & were given a flashlight by the staff. I think these accomodations are potentially dangerous and wonder if legal!
reviews.title: Overall Good Hotel

reviews.text: Traveling with large (32) student group. Located next to the RER - which made it excellent for sightseeing and excursions. Hotel was very nice - clean, rooms nice size, full bath and shower. Seemed unsafe at night between the RER and hotel entrance - but if you travel with others this should not be a problem. We stayed over a weekend - so most businesses in the area were closed.
reviews.title: Would pass on this hotel for vacationing

likes.disliked: — Location and lack of food service

reviews.title: Loved the place! , the price, the location etc..
reviews.text: I just returned from a stay at the Mercure Fontenay Sous Bois. The hotel was overall a good place to stay. The train station is right across the street and the rooms are clean. The only problem I had was there was a fire in the hotel and one of the staff knocked on our door to tell us but it was all in French so I couldn't understand him. I actually thought he was trying to clean our room until I saw people running down the stars. You would think there would at least be a fire alarm. I would also bring you own pillows with you because the pillows they give you are really flat. There was a large spread for breakfast including eggs, sausage, croissants, and cereal. Try to get down for breakfast as fast as you can because the eggs and sausage where cold. Other than that the hotel was not too bad and I would return.

As you approach the hotel and see the surrounding area, you already get put off. The hotel is by no means 4 star standard, nor what you would expect from a Mercure. It is in need of urgent refurbishment, and a complete staff retraining. My room was failry large, but spartan and cold (in the month of June). The service in the bar and restaurante was sub-standard, and the staff had no desire to attend customers. The bar had no clean glasses, and had to get some from the restaurant kitchen. It was also ditry and untidy. The restaurant was unwelcoming (looked like we were disturbing the staff who had nothing to do), the waiter stank of cigarette smoke, the food was overpriced, overcooked, and tasteless. There was a line of 15 people at checkout, and the process was agonisingly slow. Not a place to come back to!!
reviews.title: Awful hotel!

reviews.text: This hotel, another from the Mercure chain is decently located with good interiors. Rooms are quite spacious though quite old and are in need of a facelift. Restaurant is good and food variety is good.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here with a group of friends for the Paris Half-marathon. The room was fine, a double bed and a further metal-framed sofa bed. The bathroom was clean with a good powerful shower and a bath. The room temperature was great.
reviews.title: Perfectly adequate for a short stay
Terrible
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, really fresh pastries, choice of fruit, yoghurt, a limited selection of cereals, cheese and cold meat but something for everyone.

description: Located halfway between Disneyland and Paris. 10 min drive from Paris. 133 air-conditioned rooms, including 6 junior suites. 15 min to the centre by subway (RER). Restaurant and bar. Meeting facilities. Disabled rooms. Ideal for business / leisure stays.
